item.description:
The state burned 34 acres in Myles Standish last week. These "controlled burns" are done to reduce the fuel load in the forest and hopefully reduce the likeihood of a more devastating fire event (like the one that burned clear through to White Island Pond nearly 50 years ago.) (For more info on the 1964 fire, visit Mass Moments: Fire Rages )

This hike will attempt to (safely) view the area and photograph it in order to help document its recovery. The burn area was in the northeastern section of the park and is visible from Upper College Pond Road. It seems to have been contained between Priscilla Road, Upper College Pond Road and the power lines. The bike trail passes through. The Friends trail passes along part of Priscilla Road, but more to the east of the burn.

The burn area is a 15 minute walk from the parking lot and I walked around and through the complete burn area in 45 minutes the other day.  I'll estimate this walk at an hour and half total. Please bring good shoes and water with you.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Fired Up- March First Sunday Hike
